subject: p14147380
History: -year-old female with PICC from an outside hospital.
Findings: A right-sided PICC is seen with tip projecting over the mid SVC. There is a tiny left pleural effusion, as seen on outside hospital abdominal CT dated. There is patchy opacity in the left lower lobe, improved compared with. No focal consolidation or pneumothorax is seen. Heart and mediastinal contours are stable. Pneumobilia and right upper quadrant drain are noted.
Impression: 1 Right PICC with tip projecting over the mid SVC. 2 Patchy opacity in left lower lobe, improved compared with. 3 Pneumobilia and right upper quadrant drain.
